Reason: The 'skipUpscaling' configuration option is performance-sensitive. From the system level perspective, skipping upscaling during image processing can directly impact the performance by potentially saving processing time and resources. This can lead to notable performance variations depending on the size and number of images being processed. From the configuration-related code perspective, the operation of skipping upscaling is time-expensive as it involves conditional checks and decision-making logic that can affect the execution time of the image processing algorithm. Additionally, if upscaling is necessary for certain images, skipping it may result in lower quality output images, further emphasizing the performance sensitivity of this configuration.
